channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Shara Delaney – Minjerribah Middens
item.description:
Ongoing through Sunday, May 21, 2017

The William Jolly Bridge will be lit up with projections of artwork from Shara Delaney titled 'Minjerribah Middens' to celebrate MAIWAR.

This painting seeks to engage people in examining the important issue of the destruction of midden sites on Quandamooka country.

This light-up is organised by Brisbane City Council.

Venue: William Jolly Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: William Jolly Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The William Jolly Bridge will be lit up with projections of artwork from Shara Delaney titled 'Minjerribah Middens' to celebrate MAIWAR.
This painting seeks to engage people in examining the important issue of the destruction of midden sites on Quandamooka country.
This light-up is organised by Brisbane City Council.

item.title: Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, May 18, 2017

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit up lit up green and blue to support Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month.

Throughout the month of May, Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month, we are lighting up as many iconic buildings, structures and landmarks as possible in blue and green to show support for those affected by NF and to raise awareness of the condition.

This light-up is organised by Childrens Tumour Foundation.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
More info: www.ctf.org.au

This light-up is organised by Childrens Tumour Foundation.

item.title: Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, May 18, 2017

Brisbane City Hall will be lit up lit up green and blue to promote awareness for people suffering from Neurofibromatosis (NF).

Throughout the month of May, Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month, we are lighting up as many iconic buildings, structures and landmarks as possible in blue and green to show support for those affected by NF and to raise awareness of the condition.

This light-up is organised by Children's Tumour Foundation.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
More info: www.ctf.org.au

item.title: Paniyiri Festival 2017
item.description:
Friday, May 19, 2017

The Story Bridge will be lit up lit up blue and white to celebrate Paniyiri.

The Paniyiri is one of the premier multicultural events on the Queensland calendar. The festival is one of Queensland’s longest running and promotes community awareness of not only Greek culture, but the interaction and relationship of Greeks in Australia.

This light-up is organised by The Greek Orthodox Community of St George, Brisbane.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
More info: paniyiri.com
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit up lit up blue and white to celebrate Paniyiri.
The Paniyiri is one of the premier multicultural events on the Queensland calendar. The festival is one of Queenslandâ€™s longest running and promotes community awareness of not only Greek culture, but the interaction and relationship of Greeks in Australia.
This light-up is organised by The Greek Orthodox Community of St George, Brisbane.

item.title: World Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) Day
item.description:
Friday, May 19, 2017

Brisbane City Hall will be lit up purple to raise awareness for World Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) Day. 

This light-up has been organised by Australian Crohn’s and Colitis Association (ACCA).

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
More info: worldibdday.org

Brisbane City Hall will be lit up purple to raise awareness for World Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) Day. 
This light-up has been organised by Australian Crohnâ€™s and Colitis Association (ACCA).

item.title: 65 Roses Awareness Month
item.description:
Saturday, May 20 – Sunday, May 21, 2017

The Victoria Bridge will be lit up lit up red to support 65 Roses Awareness Month.

65 Roses month in May is the national awareness month for cystic fibrosis nationally as well as internationally. It is aimed at raising awareness for the disease by use of educational campaigns as well as a large number of fundraising activities and events.

This light-up is organised by Cystic Fibrosis Queensland.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
More info: www.65roses.org.au
item.xCal:description:
The Victoria Bridge will be lit up lit up red to support 65 Roses Awareness Month.
65 Roses month in May is the national awareness month for cystic fibrosis nationally as well as internationally. It is aimed at raising awareness for the disease by use of educational campaigns as well as a large number of fundraising activities and events.
This light-up is organised by Cystic Fibrosis Queensland.

item.description:
Monday, May 22 – Thursday, May 25, 2017

Brisbane City Hall and King George Square will be lit up with green, red and white lights in recognition of the Italian Week Cultural Festival.

This light up has been organised by the Italian Festival. 

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
More info: www.italianweek.com.au

item.title: The Red Shield Appeal
item.description:
Monday, May 22 – Thursday, May 25, 2017

The Victoria Bridge will be lit up lit up red to support The Red Shield Appeal.

The Red Shield Appeal is The Salvation Army’s primary annual fundraising drive, to support the various programs providing accommodation, food, counselling and other practical support for families and individuals in need.

This light-up is organised by The Salvation Army (QLD) Property Trust.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
More info: salvos.org.au…

item.title: Claudia Moodoonuthi – My body, My Country
item.description:
Wednesday, May 24 – Sunday, May 28, 2017

The William Jolly Bridge will be lit up with projections of artwork from Claudia Moodoonuthi  titled 'My body, My Country' to celebrate MAIWAR.

Claudia Moodoonuthi’s canvas paintings reflect her connection to country; her bold and colourful images are greatly influenced by her language, tribe, history and family.

This light-up is organised by Brisbane City Council.

Venue: William Jolly Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: William Jolly Bridge, Brisbane City

This light-up is organised by Brisbane City Council.

item.title: 20 Years of the Bringing Them Home Report
item.description:
Friday, May 26, 2017

The Story Bridge will be lit up lit up red, yellow & black and blue, white & green to acknowledge 20 Years of the Bringing Them Home Report.

20 Year Anniversary of the Bringing Them Home Report (26 May 2017) This Report of the National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children from their families, that is National Sorry Day.

This light-up is organised by Brisbane City Council. 

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:summary: 20 Years of the Bringing Them Home Report
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 50th Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum and Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Friday, May 26 – Saturday, May 27, 2017

Brisbane City Hall will be lit up  red & yellow on May 26 and blue & green on May 27 to commemorate the 50th Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum and Reconciliation Week.

This event is organised by the Department of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Partnerships.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 50 Year Anniversary of the Referendum
item.description:
Saturday, May 27, 2017

The  Victoria Bridge will be lit up lit up red, yellow & black to acknowledge the 50 Year Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum

The  50 year anniversary of the 1967 referendum and the landmark achievement for Indigenous Australians.

This light-up is organised by Jenwill and Brisbane Aboriginal Elders.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The  Victoria Bridge will be lit up lit up red, yellow & black to acknowledge the 50 Year Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum
The  50 year anniversary of the 1967 referendum and the landmark achievement for Indigenous Australians.
This light-up is organised by Jenwill and Brisbane Aboriginal Elders.

item.title: 50 Year Anniversary of the Referendum
item.description:
Saturday, May 27, 2017

The Story Bridge will be lit up lit up red, black and yellow to acknowledge the 50 Year Anniversary of the Referendum.

On the 27 May 1967, 90.77% of Australian voters recorded the largest ever ‘Yes’ vote in a referendum to alter the Australian Constitution. This referendum enabled Aboriginal people to be counted in the national census and allowed the Commonwealth to create laws for them, rather than just state laws.

This light-up is organised by Jenwill and Brisbane Aboriginal Elders.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit up lit up red, black and yellow to acknowledge the 50 Year Anniversary of the Referendum.
On the 27 May 1967, 90.77% of Australian voters recorded the largest ever â€˜Yesâ€™ vote in a referendum to alter the Australian Constitution. This referendum enabled Aboriginal people to be counted in the national census and allowed the Commonwealth to create laws for them, rather than just state laws.
This light-up is organised by Jenwill and Brisbane Aboriginal Elders.
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.description:
Monday, May 29 – Tuesday, May 30, 2017

Brisbane City Hall will be lit up red & yellow on 29 May and blue & green on 30 May to commemorate the 50th Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum and Reconciliation Week.

This event is organised by the Department of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Partnerships.

item.title: Italian Week 2017
item.description:
Monday, May 29 – Tuesday, May 30, 2017

The Victoria  Bridge will be lit up red, white and green to celebrate Italian Week 2017

Italian Week cultural festival seeks to promote the influence of Italian Culture in Australia and is an initiative of the Italian Government.  Italian Week promotes Italian culture and unity in Australia and the influence of multiculturalism in the long term. The festival raises money for the Hear and Say Centre for children born deaf.

This light-up is organised by Italian Festival Inc.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
More info: www.italianweek.com.au
item.xCal:description:
The Victoria  Bridge will be lit up red, white and green to celebrate Italian Week 2017
Italian Week cultural festival seeks to promote the influence of Italian Culture in Australia and is an initiative of the Italian Government.  Italian Week promotes Italian culture and unity in Australia and the influence of multiculturalism in the long term. The festival raises money for the Hear and Say Centre for children born deaf.
This light-up is organised by Italian Festival Inc.

item.title: Maroon Festival – State of Origin Game 1
item.description:
Wednesday, May 31, 2017

The Story Bridge will be lit up maroon to celebrate Maroon Festival – State of Origin Game 1.

To celebrate the Inaugural Maroon Festival, harnessing the excitement of State of Origin to Queensland and to show support for the 2017 Queensland State of Origin team

This light-up is organised by Brisbane Marketing.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
More info: www.visitbrisbane.com.au…

item.title: 50th Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum and Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Thursday, June 1 – Saturday, June 3, 2017

Brisbane City Hall will be lit up red & Yellow on 1 June, blue & green on June 2 and red & yellow on 3 June to commemorate the 50th Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum and Reconciliation Week.

This event is organised by the Department of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Partnerships.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:summary: 50th Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum and Reconciliation Week
item.xCal:description:
Brisbane City Hall will be lit up red & Yellow on 1 June, blue & green on June 2 and red & yellow on 3 June to commemorate the 50th Anniversary of the 1967 Referendum and Reconciliation Week.
This event is organised by the Department of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Partnerships.
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Italian Week 2017
item.description:
Thursday, June 1 – Friday, June 2, 2017

The Story Bridge will be lit up red, white and green to celebrate Italian Week 2017

Italian Week cultural festival seeks to promote the influence of Italian Culture in Australia and is an initiative of the Italian Government.  Italian Week promotes Italian culture and unity in Australia and the influence of multiculturalism in the long term. The festival raises money for the Hear and Say Centre for children born deaf.

This light-up is organised by Italian Festival Inc.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
More info: www.italianweek.com.au

The festival raises money for the Hear and Say Centre for children born deaf.
This light-up is organised by Italian Festival Inc.

item.title: Mabo Day – the 25 Year Anniversary of Eddie Kioki Mabo
item.description:
Saturday, June 3, 2017

The Victoria Bridge will be lit up red, yellow & black and blue, white & green to acknowledge Mabo Day – the 25 Year Anniversary of Eddie Kioki Mabo, a Torres Strait Islander who campaigned for Indigenous Land Rights.

On 3 June 1992, a landmark decision of the High Court of Australia overturned the legal fiction of terra nullius which had characterised Australian law with regards to land and title since the voyage of James Cook in 1770

This light-up is organised by Brisbane City Council. 

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:summary: Mabo Day â€“ the 25 Year Anniversary of Eddie Kioki Mabo

item.title: Queensland Week
item.description:
Tuesday, June 6, 2017

Brisbane City Hall is being lit up with maroon lights to celebrate Queensland Week. 

Queensland Week is an annual celebration that centres around the state’s birthday on 6 June.

This light up has been organised by the Department of Premier and Cabinet, Queensland Government.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
More info: www.qld.gov.au…

item.title: National Blood Donor Week
item.description:
Wednesday, June 14, 2017

Brisbane City Hall will be lit up red to raise awareness for National Blood Donor Week.

This light-up has been organised by The Australian Red Cross.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
More info: www.donateblood.com.au…

This light-up has been organised by The Australian Red Cross.

item.description:

Brisbane City Hall is being lit up with purple lights to raise awareness for World Elder Abuse Day.

This light up has been organised by UnitingCare Community.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
